means: 降低质量（地位、价格等）( debase的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Enterprises can win the market by debasing the price and receive reward by aftermarket service.
sentence.Network_cn: 企业还可以通过降低产品销售价格赢得市场,依靠售后服务取得回报,提高产品的市场占有率.

list.abs: (2) [debase oneself]∶屈身事人不为五斗米折腰向乡里小人。——梁· 萧统《文选·陶渊明传》 安能摧眉折腰事权贵,使我不得开心颜。——唐· 李白《梦游.
For a man will not debase himself by work , which requires neither skill nor courage ., 一个人不会因既不要求技巧也不要求勇气的工作而贬低自己.

following analysis the intention of assets debasing the author put forward some countermeasures to perfect and normalize assets debasing accounting information in terms of problems there .通过对资产减值会计的实质内涵的确认与计量的分析，应针对资产减值会计信息中存在的问题，采取完善和规范资产减值会计信息的对策。
The lasting war debased the value of the dollar ., 持久的战争使美元贬值.

entry.tran: 降低…的价值（或质量）；使贬值
entry.def: To debase something means to reduce its value or quality.

example.ex: Politicians have debased the meaning of the word 'freedom'...
example.tran: 政客们贬低了“自由”一词的意义。

example.ex: He said parliament and the process of democracy had been debased.
example.tran: 他说议会和民主程序已遭贬值。

means.word_mean: 1. used of conduct; characterized by dishonor

auth_sentence.content: "They thought that comparing Miscavige to Martin Luther King was debasing his character," he says.
auth_sentence.res_content: "They thought that comparing Miscavige to Martin Luther King was debasing his character," he says.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "They thought that comparing Miscavige to Martin Luther King was debasing his character," he says.
